question: You have learnt about human ______ system and its functions in Chapter 2.
Now, let’s discuss a closely related topic – ______ health.
The term simply refers to healthy reproductive organs with normal ______.
It has a broader perspective and includes the emotional and ______ aspects of reproduction.
According to the ______ Health Organisation (WHO), reproductive health means a total well-being in all aspects of reproduction.
Reproductive health means a total well-being in all aspects of reproduction, i.e., physical, emotional, behavioural and ______.
A society with people having physically and functionally normal reproductive ______ might be called reproductively healthy.
India was amongst the first countries in the world to initiate ______ plans and programmes at a national level.
India was amongst the first countries in the world to initiate action plans and ______ at a national level.
These programmes called ‘family planning’ were initiated in ______.
These programmes called ‘______ planning’ were initiated in 1951.
The programmes were periodically ______ over the past decades.
Improved programmes covering wider reproduction-related areas are currently in ______.
The improved programmes operate under the popular name ‘Reproductive and Child Health Care (______) programmes’.
The improved programmes operate under the popular name ‘Reproductive and ______ Health Care (RCH) programmes’.
Creating awareness among people about various reproduction-related ______ is a major task under these programmes.
Creating ______ among people about various reproduction-related aspects is a major task under these programmes.
Providing ______ and support for building up a reproductively healthy society is a major task under these programmes.
Providing facilities and ______ for building up a reproductively healthy society is a major task under these programmes.
Reproductive health includes the emotional, behavioural and ______ aspects.
A society with normal emotional and behavioural ______ among them in all sex-related aspects might be called reproductively healthy.
The term reproductive health includes the emotional and ______ aspects of reproduction.
Reproductive health means total well-being in all aspects of ______.
A reproductively healthy society requires physically and functionally normal reproductive ______.
India was one of the first countries to initiate action plans at a ______ level.
Family planning programmes were periodically ______ over the past decades.
Improved programmes covering wider reproduction-related areas are currently in operation under the popular name ‘Reproductive and ______ Health Care (RCH) programmes’.
Creating awareness among people and providing facilities are the major tasks under these ______.
The World Health Organisation is abbreviated as ______.
Reproductive health is a state of total well-being in physical, emotional, behavioural and ______ aspects.
Normal emotional and behavioural interactions among them in all ______-related aspects might be called reproductively healthy.
India initiated family planning programmes in the year ______.
Family planning programmes aimed to attain total reproductive health as a ______ goal.
